bug.short_desc: [PerspectiveBar] Perspective bar does not expand to show newly opened perspective(s)

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 86509 Screenshot showing my placement of toolbars
Build ID: I20080108-1320
Steps To Reproduce: 1. I have the perspective toolbar docked on the left 2. I have the view toolbar docked on the left just below the perspective toolbar 3. When I open a new perspective, the view toolbar does not "move down" so as to let the perspective toolbar "expand" and show the new perspective icon.
More information:
Ooops, good pickup! This is an edge condition I didn't handle when changing the resize mechanics in the trim.
Committed in >20080110. Now force a resize when add/removing perspective shortcuts when the switcher is docked on the left.
No problem Vijay, regressions always move to the top of the stack...
This has regressed again. Same screenshots and steps to reproduce as before. I am currently using Version: 3.4.0 Build id: I20080108-1320

Created attachment 86965 Screenshot with the currently active perspective not showing up in the perspective bar
Here I have the Java perspective open, but it doesnt show up in the Perspective Bar. I had only the Debug perspective open, closed Eclipse, reopened Eclipse (with just the Debug perspective open), then opened the Java Perspective - and this is the screenshot of my workbench at this time.

Vijay, you have to use a build -after- 20080110; your build id says it's from the 8th (I20080108-1320). Please try one from Jan 11th or later...feel free to (re)re-open if it's not working then...;-).
Verified in build: Version: 3.4.0 Build id: I20080122-1200

attachment.desc: Screenshot showing my placement of toolbars
